body: Also, as far as I know, this is an intrinsic issue with any intrusive pointers and the pImpl pattern because there is no way to communicate that the pImpl type must inherit from c10::intrusive_ptr_target without defining it completely, which is exactly what the pImpl pattern is trying to avoid.
body_html: Also, as far as I know, this is an intrinsic issue with any intrusive pointers and the pImpl pattern because there is no way to communicate that the pImpl type must inherit from c10::intrusive_ptr_target without defining it completely, which is exactly what the pImpl pattern is trying to avoid.
body_text: Also, as far as I know, this is an intrinsic issue with any intrusive pointers and the pImpl pattern because there is no way to communicate that the pImpl type must inherit from c10::intrusive_ptr_target without defining it completely, which is exactly what the pImpl pattern is trying to avoid.
